thread.title: Assistant UMKC basketball coach in stripper scandal resigns
thread.title_full: Assistant UMKC basketball coach in stripper scandal resigns

title: Assistant UMKC basketball coach in stripper scandal resigns
text:
Assistant UMKC basketball coach in stripper scandal resigns By: WKYT Sports Staff Posted: Fri 2:09 PM, Oct 23, 2015 By: WKYT Sports Staff / Article More Video... Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen, a tell-all book claiming that a former University of Louisville staffer hired escorts for players and recruits, was now the #1 selling book under basketball on Amazon. Related Links Cardinals coach Rick Pitino says 'I will not resign and let you down' Photo: IBJ Book Publishing 
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) - An assistant University of Missouri-Kansas City basketball coach has resigned, saying he can't do his job while battling what he called "false allegations" that he hired dancers to strip and have sex with recruits while he was a coach at Louisville. 
UMKC announced Andre McGee's resignation Friday. He had been on paid administrative leave since Oct. 2, when the allegations surfaced. 
Escort Katrina Powell has told ESPN that McGee paid $10,000 for 22 shows that took place in a Louisville dormitory from 2010 to 2014. Louisville coach Rick Pitino has denied any knowledge of such parties and said he will not resign. 
McGee played at Louisville before becoming a graduate assistant coach and director of men's basketball operations. He left the university last year to become an assistant at UMKC.
